subject: Leadership
title: The Power of Story
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Power of Story.

hook.text: A nonprofit shows donors a spreadsheet of stats. Donations stay flat. Then they share one child's story. Giving soars.

buildup.text: Stories activate the brain differently than data. They trigger empathy, memory, and action in ways facts alone can't.

discovery.text: Neuroscience shows stories release oxytocin, the trust hormone. Listeners feel connected to the teller and the message.

twist.text: Leaders who rely only on data miss hearts. Data persuades minds; stories move people to act. Both matter.

climax.text: Great leaders pair every key message with a story. Structure: character, challenge, change. Keep it under 90 seconds.

punchline.text: Facts tell. Stories sell. Leaders who story-tell, excel.

quiz.question: Why are stories more powerful than data alone?
options: They activate empathy and memory in the brain
They replace the need for facts
